analytic.title: The Anatomy of Non-Biblical Scrolls from the Cairo Geniza

biblStruct.note: The discovery in the Cairo Geniza of more than fifty fragments of horizontal scrolls containing texts that differ from liturgical biblical readings shows that a scroll format was used for non-biblical books long after the Jewish adoption of the codex format. This paper looks at the physical and palaeographical aspects of scrolls containing Talmud, Midrash, Targum and liturgical texts produced between the 9th and 11th century.
